lines.text: Poor unfortunate girl.
She was a tramp.
She was a human being. Let me remind you that even the most unworthy of us has a right to life and the pursuit of happiness.
From what I hear she pursued it in all directions.
I may be old-fashioned, but I thought murder was against the law.
My theory is that everyone is a potential murderer.
Don't worry, I'm not going to shoot you, Mr. Haines. It might disturb Mother.
I still think it would be wonderful to have a man love you so much he'd kill for you.
You had no trouble, of course, with the police once they verified your alibi?
When an alibi is full of bourbon, sir, it can't stand up.
When's the wedding?
The what?
The wedding. It's in the papers.
Well, it shouldn't be. Not unless they legalized bigamy overnight.
I admire people who do things.
[first lines]
I beg your pardon, but aren't you Guy Haines?
Oh, Daddy doesn't mind a little scandal. He's a senator.
It's pretty late to start flirting with a discarded husband.
I'll have him called up immediately.
Obstructing the wheels of justice, Daddy?
Doesn't that bloodhound ever relax? He sticks so close he's beginning to grow on me - like a fungus.
Well, I do hope you've forgotten about that silly little plan of yours.
Which one?
About blowing up the White House.
Oh, Ma, I was only fooling. Besides, what would the President say?
You're a naughty boy, Bruno.

You know, I read of a case once. I think it would be a wonderful idea! I can take him out in the car, and when we get to a very lonely spot, knock him on the head with a hammer, pour gasoline over him and over the car, and set the whole thing ablaze!
[giggles]

[scowls]
And have to walk all the way home? Oh, no.

[meek]
No? Oh...
No, no. I have the best way, and the best tools.
[raises hands]
Simple, silent, and quick - the silent part being the most important. Let me show you what I mean. You don't mind if I borrow your neck for a moment, do you?

[simpers]
Well... if it's not for long!

[Last Lines]
I beg your pardon, but aren't you Guy Haines?
[Guy and Anne get up and walk away without saying a word to the man]
One doesn't always have to say what one thinks.
I have a theory that you should do everything before you die.

Everyone has somebody that they want to put out of the way. Oh now surely, Madam, you're not going to tell me that there hasn't been a time that you didn't want to dispose of someone. Your husband, for instance?
these two hands.

[jumps into nearby car]
Excuse me, madam. We need your help. We're chasing a man.
Really? How exciting.
Come see my painting.
[walks into next room]
Bruno, I do wish you would take up painting. It's such a soothing pastime.

[prolonged laugh]
Oh, Mother, you're wonderful. That's the old boy, alright. That's Father.
Is it? Oh. I was trying to paint Saint Francis.
You crazy maniac! Would you please get out of here and leave me alone?
But Guy... I like you.
[offended, Guy punches Bruno in the face]
can you imagine being able to smell a flower - on the planet Mars? I'd like to have lunch with you someday soon, sir. Tell you more about it.
Criss-cross.
How did you get him to do it?
I... get him to do it?
He killed Miriam, didn't he?
[Guy stares at Anne, hesitating to answer]
Tell me, didn't he.
Yes. He's a maniac. I met him on the train going to Metcalf. He had some crazy scheme about exchanging murders. I'd do his murder; he'd do mine.
What do you mean "your murder" Guy?
He read about me in the papers. He knew about Miriam, about you. He suggested that if he got rid of Miriam for me I should kill his father.
You must have known he was talking nonsense.
But he wasn't! Of course I didn't give it another thought. And now a lunatic wants me to kill his father.
It's too fantastic.
Yes, isn't it?
You mean, you've known about Miriam all this time?
Since the first night. He gave me her glasses.
Why didn't you call the policee?
And have them say what you did? "Mr. Haines, how did you get him to do it?" And Bruno would say we planned it together.
Who's the interesting-looking Frenchman with the Darvilles?
His name's Antony... he's not French.
